content.title: Intro
content.content:
1979
Preceded by
1979
1980
Year
1981
Followed by
1981
You may also be looking for Third Age 1980.

Tolkien-related events that took place in 1980.

content.title: January
content.content:
? - Amon Hen 43 is published.
? - Quettar is founded.

content.title: February
content.content:
9 - Actor Heron Carvic dies.
29 - A Reader's Guide to The Silmarillion is published.

content.title: May
content.content:
11 - The Return of the King (1980 film) is released on VHS in the United States.
22 - Actress Nazanin Boniadi is born.
28 - Second edition of The Languages of Tolkien's Middle-earth is published.
29 - Poems and Stories is published.
29 - Actor Adam Brown is born.
? - Amon Hen 44 is published.

content.title: July
content.content:
25-28 - Mythcon 11.
26-3 Aug - At the Griffoni Film Festival, Ralph Bakshi wins the Golden Gryphon for The Lord of the Rings.
? - Amon Hen 45 is published.

content.title: August
content.content:
22 - Actor Norman Shelley dies.
29 - Author Douglas C. Kenney dies.
31 - Amon Hen 46 is published.

content.title: October
content.content:
2 - Unfinished Tales is published in the UK.
? - A Walk Through the Shire is published.

content.title: November
content.content:
6 - Nevill Coghill, Inkling, dies
18 - Unfinished Tales is published in the US.
? - Amon Hen 47 is published.

content.title: December
content.content:
21 - The premiere of the first episode of German radio serial adaptation Der Hobbit, a production of public broadcaster Westdeutscher Rundfunk Kôln (WDR Kôln).
26 - Conclusion of the German radio serial adaptation Der Hobbit.
29 - Amon Hen 48 is published.

? - The 1981 J.R.R. Tolkien Calendar is released.
? - The J.R.R. Tolkien Desk Calendar 1981 is released.
? - Shire Calendar 1981 is released.
? - The 1981 J.R.R. Tolkien Calendar - The Lord of the Rings is released.
? - The Lord of the Rings Souvenir booklet commemorating twenty five years of its publication is published.
? - Mallorn 14 is published.
Years
1977 1978 1979 1980 1981 1982 1983
